intro: Gynochthodes wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to anchor in loose soil, while its leaves are narrow and evergreen. Gynochthodes wallichii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
